an6.33:4.1: “Tonight, a beautiful god, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, came to me,
an6.33:4.4: “Sir, these six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.
an6.33:4.6: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for conscience, and for prudence.
an6.33:4.7: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.”
an6.33:4.8: That is what that god said.
an6.33:4.9: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.
an6.33:5.1: “Respect for the Teacher and the teaching,
an6.33:5.2: and keen respect for the Saṅgha;
an6.33:5.6: and has drawn near to extinguishment.”
